meanings.sent1: The room was murky, with shadows lurking in every corner.
meanings.sent2: The forest became murky as the sun set behind the trees.
meanings.sent3: The murky sky seemed to be playing hide and seek with the stars.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as murky as the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The murky waters of the lake reflected the stormy clouds above.

meanings.definition: Unclear or confused in meaning or expression
meanings.sent1: His explanation was so murky that no one understood what he meant.
meanings.sent2: The instructions on the package were murky and hard to follow.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's handwriting was so murky that even the students struggled to read it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt as murky as a foggy morning, unable to grasp the concept.
meanings.sent5: The conversation became murky as they delved into complex topics.

meanings.sent1: The ancient text was written in a murky language that few could decipher.
meanings.sent2: The concept of quantum physics can be murky for those unfamiliar with the subject.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate the city without a map felt like walking through a murky maze.
meanings.sent4: The truth behind the rumors remained as murky as a fog-covered lake.
meanings.sent5: The details of the contract were purposely made murky to confuse the parties involved.
